Brazil: Marcos Pontes becomes the first Brazilian and the first native Portuguese-speaking person to go into space, where he stays on the International Space Station for a week. During his trip, Pontes carries out eight experiments selected by the Brazilian Space Agency. He lands in Kazakhstan on 8 April 2006, with the crew of Expedition 12.
Lei Maria da Penha is sanctioned by president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.
Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907 leads to the 2006–07 Brazilian aviation crisis.
